description: Technical dashboard for asset performance, reliability metrics, and failure analysis

targets.rawSql:
WITH time_slots AS ( 
  SELECT generate_series( 
    $__timeFrom(), 
    $__timeTo(), 
    '1 day'::interval 
  ) as slot_start 
), 
asset_availability AS ( 
  SELECT 
    ts.slot_start as time, 
    a.id as asset_id, 
    a.name as asset_name, 
    -- Calculate availability for each day 
    CASE 
      WHEN (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (ts.slot_start + '1 day'::interval - ts.slot_start)) / 3600) = 0 THEN 100 
      ELSE 
        100 - ( 
          (SELECT COALESCE(SUM(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (LEAST(ad.starts_on + (ad.duration || ' seconds')::interval, ts.slot_start + '1 day'::interval) - GREATEST(ad.starts_on, ts.slot_start)))), 0) 
           FROM asset_downtime ad 
           WHERE ad.asset_id = a.id 
             AND ad.starts_on < ts.slot_start + '1 day'::interval 
             AND ad.starts_on + (ad.duration || ' seconds')::interval > ts.slot_start 
             AND ad.company_id = a.company_id) 
          / 
          (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM ('1 day'::interval)) / 3600) 
          * 100 
        ) 
    END as availability 
  FROM time_slots ts 
  CROSS JOIN asset a 
  WHERE a.archived = false 
) 
SELECT 
  time, 
  asset_name as metric, 
  availability as value 
FROM asset_availability 
WHERE availability IS NOT NULL 
ORDER BY time, asset_name

SELECT 
  a.name as asset, 
  COUNT(ad.*) as failure_count, 
  COUNT(ad.*) * 1.0 / NULLIF(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM ($__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP)) / 3600 / 24, 0) as failures_per_day 
FROM asset a 
LEFT JOIN asset_downtime ad ON a.id = ad.asset_id 
  AND a.archived = false 
  AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND a.company_id = ad.company_id 
GROUP BY a.name 
ORDER BY failures_per_day DESC 
LIMIT 15

SELECT 
  ad.duration / 3600 as duration_hours, 
  COUNT(*) as count 
FROM asset_downtime ad 
JOIN asset a ON ad.asset_id = a.id 
  AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND ad.company_id = a.company_id 
GROUP BY duration_hours 
ORDER BY duration_hours

SELECT 
  'Downtime' as reason, 
  COUNT(*) as count, 
  SUM(ad.duration / 3600) as total_hours 
FROM asset_downtime ad 
JOIN asset a ON ad.asset_id = a.id 
  AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND ad.company_id = a.company_id 
GROUP BY reason 
ORDER BY total_hours DESC

SELECT 
  DATE_TRUNC('week', wo.created_at) as time, 
  a.name as metric, 
  COUNT(wo.*) as work_order_count 
FROM work_order wo 
JOIN asset a ON wo.asset_id = a.id 
  AND wo.created_at >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND wo.created_at <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
  AND wo.company_id = a.company_id 
GROUP BY DATE_TRUNC('week', wo.created_at), a.name 
ORDER BY time, metric

WITH failure_events AS ( 
  SELECT 
    ad.asset_id, 
    ad.starts_on as failure_time, 
    LEAD(ad.starts_on) OVER (PARTITION BY ad.asset_id ORDER BY ad.starts_on) as next_failure_time, 
    ad.company_id 
  FROM asset_downtime ad 
  JOIN asset a ON ad.asset_id = a.id 
    AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
    AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
    AND ad.company_id = a.company_id 
) 
SELECT 
  a.name as asset_name, 
  a.custom_id as asset_id, 
  COUNT(fe.*) as failure_count, 
  AVG(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (fe.next_failure_time - fe.failure_time)) / 3600) as mtbf_hours, 
  MIN(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (fe.next_failure_time - fe.failure_time)) / 3600) as min_mtbf_hours, 
  MAX(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (fe.next_failure_time - fe.failure_time)) / 3600) as max_mtbf_hours 
FROM failure_events fe 
RIGHT JOIN asset a ON fe.asset_id = a.id 
  AND a.archived = false 
  AND a.company_id = fe.company_id 
GROUP BY a.id, a.name, a.custom_id 
ORDER BY mtbf_hours ASC 
LIMIT 20

panels.title: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) by Asset

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  a.id as asset_id, 
  a.name as asset_name, 
  a.custom_id as custom_id, 
  ac.name as category, 
  l.name as location, 
  a.manufacturer as manufacturer, 
  a.model as model, 
  a.serial_number as serial_number, 
  a.in_service_date as in_service_date, 
  a.warranty_expiration_date as warranty_expiration, 
  -- Calculate current availability 
  CASE 
    WHEN (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM ($__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP)) / 3600) = 0 THEN 100 
    ELSE 
      100 - ( 
        (SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ad.duration / 3600), 0) 
         FROM asset_downtime ad 
         WHERE ad.asset_id = a.id 
           AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
           AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
           AND ad.company_id = a.company_id) 
        / 
        (EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM ($__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP)) / 3600) 
        * 100 
      ) 
  END as current_availability, 
  -- Calculate total downtime 
  (SELECT COALESCE(SUM(ad.duration / 3600), 0) 
   FROM asset_downtime ad 
   WHERE ad.asset_id = a.id 
     AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
     AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
     AND ad.company_id = a.company_id) as total_downtime_hours, 
  -- Calculate failure count 
  (SELECT COUNT(*) 
   FROM asset_downtime ad 
   WHERE ad.asset_id = a.id 
     AND ad.starts_on >= $__timeFrom()::TIMESTAMP 
     AND ad.starts_on <= $__timeTo()::TIMESTAMP 
     AND ad.company_id = a.company_id) as failure_count 
FROM asset a 
LEFT JOIN asset_category ac ON a.category_id = ac.id 
LEFT JOIN location l ON a.location_id = l.id 
  AND a.archived = false 
ORDER BY current_availability ASC, failure_count DESC 
LIMIT 50
